Reviews.Title: “Basic, clean hotel at a good price”
Reviews.Author: Sc00bysnacks
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at Hotel Sterling, and it is a very good budget 3 star hotel. We were lucky to get a room with a balcony (room 601) which made all the difference. The front desk were quick to sort out a problem with the a/c and were generally friendly. Hotel Sterling is clean and tidy, and well located. The included breakfast, whilst nothing to write home about, sets you up for a days sightseeing. Would happiliy stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, basic hotel, a block north of Gran Via”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good value, but the rooms are fairly small and very Spartan. They are clean, but the only furnishing in our room was two twin beds, a shared night stand, and a wall mounted television. There is no decoration of any kind. On the other hand, they have a nice complimentary breakfast buffet, and it is just a short walk to the historic area of Madrid, the palace and the opera. It is 15-20 minutes to walk to the art museums. Madrid has an extensive metro and the closest stop is only about 100m.

Reviews.Title: “Madrid Vacation”
Reviews.Author: kokobeans
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and the people at the front desk were nice. However, a nice bangle that I inadvertently left out was stolen from my room. When I wrote the hotel to inquire if anyone had found it, I never even received a response. The internet did not work. The location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good”
Reviews.Author: Bruno M
Reviews.Content: Hotel Sterling is a very good hotel, for a 3* hotel. The staff is very attentive. The breakfast is good. They offer an iPad interelly free for use during the days of stay. Very Near of subway station "Noviciado".

Reviews.Title: “3 star surprise.”
Reviews.Author: Discodave81
Reviews.Content: For a 3 star hotel i wasnt expecting too much but i was surprised. Very clean and fantastic location. The room was a little small but very cosy and the bed was very comfortable. Service was adequate yet breakfast was nothing to shout about. Value for money? Yes! Overall very good and i would come back and recommend it for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money!!!”
Reviews.Author: Yiannisk77
Reviews.Content: Very good rooms, very good location in walking distance from everything . Poor breakfast clean and remodeled bathroom .. Helpfull personel with 24 hour mini market right next to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: Damian P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Stirling Hotel for a long weekend. The hotel was clean, everything worked, including an excellent shower, and the staff were extremely friendly and helpful, The location is great, close to the Metro and bus stops and there are shops and restaurants nearby. Whilst the rooms are basic, there is everything you need for a good night's sleep and breakfast is fine. We would certainly recommend the Stirling and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sterling, a great little hotel, fab location, would go again!”
Reviews.Author: danimallorca
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel for a short city break, two rooms (one double, one double for single use). I picked it based on price and location. It turns out that I had stayed at this hotel many years ago, when it was operating under a different name and before the refurb. The service was excellent (especially Front Desk and Housekeeping), the breakfast was fine (nothing fancy, just a decent buffet breakfast with cheese / ham / cereal / bread / pastries / fruit juice / fruit / tea and coffee) and the rooms were spacious and clean. One of the rooms looked out onto the Calle San Bernardo (it was a bit noisy), the other looked out onto a back street... but had a little terrace! How fantastic is it, that in the middle of a busy city centre like Madrid you can have your own terrace complete with two chairs and a table!. Fantastic. The amenities were fine, the connection for metro was good, and it is within easy walking distance from the Gran Via, the Plaza Callao, the Plaza España, Debod Temple, etc. I will be going back, for sure. :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, but not the place to stay in!”
Reviews.Author: Bobbylid
Reviews.Content: The location was wonderful, close to all the stations and a walk to the nearest sights. Very clean and the staff are friendly, but if you're looking for a place to stay in, there's not much there. The rooms were basic with the beds not being very comfy and our view was a brick wall so you couldn't really tell what the weather was like which was a bit annoying, saying that you could pick up BBC World and the weather in Madrid popped up every 30 mins - Who needs windows! The breakfast was pretty basic and we only went down once, but we more than made up for it at the San Gines Chocolate and Churros. Would certainly recommend the place, but be aware it's not glorious but is the perfect place for a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: WendyWoo9839
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a three day break in Madrid and chose to stay in the Hotel Sterling. The hotel is located centrally and was an excellent base to explore the city. Breakfast was OK - plenty to eat and good based on the price we paid. I travelled with my husband and 9 year old and we had a triple roon - the room was plenty big enough and decorated to a good standard. The only downside for me (and this is personal) was lack of tea/coffee in the room - but cafe just downstairs and no issues with taking drinks to the room. Overall very good value and would book again.

Reviews.Title: “very central”
Reviews.Author: minanabil77
Reviews.Content: what is most important about this hotel is its very central location in Madrid, very close to 2 underground stations and the Grand via which is full of shops and restaurants that has got something for everyone, the hotel is fine with nice rooms and breakfast was plentiful.

Reviews.Title: “super weekend”
Reviews.Author: piter56
Reviews.Content: Hotel ma świetne położenie.Prawie wszystko w odległości spaceru.100 m od stacji metra Noviciado.Pokój dość duży.Łazienka nowoczesna.Czysto.Obsługa bardzo miła.Jedyne czego można się przyczepić to śniadania.Niby dużo,niby zróżnicowane ale nie najlepszej jakości ale za pieniądze,które zapłaciliśmy za pobyt nie ma co narzekać.Ogólnie hotel wart polecenia.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotrl”
Reviews.Author: mcdthemanager
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel in central location. Stayed with friends and had good sized rooms. Very clean. Rooms had small balcony with table and chairs. Breakfast was good and plentiful. Hotel staff friendly, helpful and spoke good English. Location very good. Just short walk from Grand Via and other areas of interest.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Melissa G
Reviews.Content: Overall, this was good value for the money. The location of the hotel was central and a walk away from shopping and central Madrid. If you couldn't walk there, you could easily take the metro. I found the staff to be pleasant but my husband spoke the language so it made it a lot easier to communicate. The room was basic but decent size. The breakfast was also basic but I like they offered fresh fruit, coffee and tea. Overall, a good place to stay if you are on a budget. If you are looking for something fancy, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good for what you pay”
Reviews.Author: purpler0nnie
Reviews.Content: Arrived late at night, checked in no trouble. There is free wifi in the reception area and not throughout the hotel which we were led to believe there was. Breakfast was basic to say the least! At least they did tea and coffee. If cold toasted baguettes is your thing you would love it here! Our room was small and dated but cleaned every day. When in a different city we tend not to stay in a room the whole trip anyway! Our 3 nights in Madrid took us to see the football at Bernabeu which, if you get chance, is a must for anyone! I am not a huge football fan but this experience was awesome! We also did the behind the scenes trip which (in my opinion) is better than Barcelona's ground. One piece of advice, please be careful on the metro. Pickpockets are very clever and will have your belongings in a flash before you even notice anything has gone.

Reviews.Title: “Small, Dark and Depressing Rooms”
Reviews.Author: MichelleCook
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on my way to Barcelona. I arrived at 8:30 AM and they were unable to provide a room until 11AM. I had informed them that I would be arriving at that time and requested a room early. They started cleaning rooms at 9AM and told me they would have a room available at 9:30 AM. I was suffering from jet lag and this made it very difficult. I was given a room in the interior that was in the back of the hotel facing a wall. The room was very small. It was dark and I dreaded spending any time in the room. The blanket for the bed was filthy. The front desk sent me to a terrible restaurant. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awful!”
Reviews.Author: slwityk
Reviews.Content: Never again! In fact when we returned to Madrid booked another hotel for the same price which was great. Staff at the Alexandra were not helpful in anyway, had to beg them to help with the luggage as we had a car and the parking site was quite a way from the hotel and we needed to unload the luggage near the hotel. Renovations going on at the time and we didn't know about them and the noise was bad. Would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Sterling”
Reviews.Author: manchoy
Reviews.Content: First impression was that the hotel is cleaner than expected, given that building work still appears to be going on. Noise doesn't start until after 9am, no dust anywhere, & cleaner than most hotels I have stayed in. 24 hour reception, lifts worked ok. It's now called the Sterling, not the Alexander, it may be useful to have the full address including the street name & number for the taxi driver if you don't know the way yourself. The room was small but well equipped, & everything in the room worked ok. I had an excellent view of the fire escape, the area outside of the window was narrow, tall & shadey so the air outside was never too hot to have the window open. The airconditioning outlet looked quite small, but as the room is also small it functioned well enough for me to have to increase the temperature during the first night. (Digital thermostat with one-degree increments.) Hot water was reliable and at a good pressure. The bathroom was spotlessly clean, the sink had a small selection of the usual goodies (soap, shower gel, shampoo). Hairdrier worked ok, I don't need one but I had to test it... Shaver socket in the bathroom, 220Vac. I counted a total of four power points in the room, three above the desk & another hidden beneath it. Storage in the room was adequate, with a wardrobe containing a roomsafe & several drawers, and a small desk unit. The bed was clean & comfortable. No noise from the street (being away from the road), or from the neighbours, although I stayed Monday to Friday so I missed the weekend. Large flatscreen TV with remote control, easily found a music channel (Kiss- channel 31). Room entry uses a swipe card, once the card is swiped against the sensor the door just pushes open. The lights don't work until the card is fed into the slot on the wall just inside the door. The door has a robust looking double lock. Lighting in the room was good. Breakfast room in the basement ok, self-service continental. 7.30 - 10 am. Croissants, toast, rolls, ham, salami, cheese (sliced but stuck together in one lump!), coffee, hot & cold milk, cereals, fruit juice, butter, honey & jam. No eggs though. No bar or restaurant, but there are plenty around nearby. The bars in Calle San Bernardo close about 11pm, but the ones along the Gran Via stay open later. There is a bar directly in front of the hotel, I had two beers with tapas for 5 euros. Taxi from airport to hotel: 35 euros plus 5 euros airport charge. Taxi from hotel to airport: 25 euros. About 1/2 hour each way, time & cost will depend on the traffic.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: DavidRowlands
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in May 2011. The hotel was good value and was clean. Staff were OK. Breakfast was a bit boring but can't complain for the price. The really good thing about this hotel is its location. It was easy to get there from the airport and it is within easy walking of many of the shops and sites. It is close to a number of Metro stations. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: TamaRJesky
Reviews.Content: This was a clean hotel. The room was comfortable and quiet and close to site seeing. The breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good value modern hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: tony1293
Reviews.Content: The hotel has very recently been renovated and renamed the Hotel Sterling. The decor is simple and understated and both the public areas and my bedroom were kept very clean and tidy. Bedrooms have flat screen TVs with 50 channels (all Spanish language), a good size bathroom and plenty of power points for charging phones etc. Breakfast was a perfectly adequate buffet. The hotel is in Calle San Bernardo which is a fairly busy street and is only two minutes walk to the Gran Via, very close to the Plaza de Callao cinema and theatre district. It is a similar distance from Noviciado Metro station if you are travelling further afield in Madrid. There is no gym, pool etc, but at around £50/€60 including breakfast I think this is good value for a city centre hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: Enzo_RM
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, beautiful exterior and elegant interior. The most beautiful building in central Madrid. Excellent location in central Madrid. Spacious, beautiful, comfortable. Breakfast very good and plentiful. Hotel staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Alexandra - Great Madrid Hotel”
Reviews.Author: zigzag2
Reviews.Content: Location: Madrid, Spain, Europe I was at the hotel for 5 nights a weeks ago and can recommend it VERY highly. I had a really nice, clean and spacious room overlooking the main street (I asked for that). It was well-equipped and had a strong and hot shower and maid service was fine. I had spoken to Almudena at reception prior to booking and arrival. She is fluent in English as also is Ivan at reception. But having named those two, I must stress that ALL the reception staff were cheerful, helpful and highly professional – helping with information and even confirming a restaurant booking for me with no hesitation. It is the sort of service one would normally expect from a much higher priced hotel. Unfortunately I don’t know all their names or I would mention them all. The Alexandra is in the last stages of renovation but this didn’t disturb me in any way. Not noisy or intrusive. Some of the corridor carpets are a trifle dusty - but why would anyone need to stand in a corridor for more than 30 seconds while going from the elevator to their bedrooms? The hotel location is about 2 minutes off the Gran Via - so totally central and even arrival by metro from Barajas, with a couple of line changes, was not that difficult (as I only had hand luggage anyway). The hotel is within a 5-minute walk to Callao and Sol… and in fact is really so central that it’s within walking distance to nearly everywhere. Breakfast was adequate and there was plenty of it. The dining room was pretty busy and staff quickly replaced food items on empty dishes. On my next visit to Madrid (which I hope won’t be too long away), I will most definitely stay at Hotel Alexandra. The staff are all so willing and happy and the hotel is such good value for money - which is often difficult to find in a beautiful and vibrant capital city. And I really loved Madrid thanks to all the Tripadvisor experts from whom I got loads of help. PS: Mustn't forget Botin. I did so much enjoy their set 3-course meal (roast suckling pig!!) and the staff were courteous and accommodated me cheerfully despite having no reservation and turning up at 9.45 p.m.

Reviews.Title: “typical hotel”
Reviews.Author: magko
Reviews.Content: The room was big and clean but the breakfast was less than poor.The whole building is under construction for renovation.It is near GRAND VIA for shopping and about 500metres from a metro station. The staff was not so friendly (all of them are in the point to one or two years before the retirement) and especially one guy must change job because i was to the point to threat him when he didn t want to give me a receipt when i went there the next day after my check out. To conclude the 150 euro i gave for only one night where more than enough for this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “No way....................”
Reviews.Author: tc_spurs
Reviews.Content: Had a room at the back with one window looking into a square chasm. No sunlight. The building work was a bind but still a rubbish room/prison cell. It was too dark and the shower did not work. Pay for what you get but would have liked a balcony room at the front.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great room but will be better when building work complete”
Reviews.Author: Hop_Picker10
Reviews.Content: Arrived to find front of hotel shrouded in scaffolding. Mix up with booking meant we were asked to pay for prepaid rooms and that was difficult with receptionist who spoke no English. But, we were given a great newly refurbished room with balcony. Room was spotlessly clean and comfortable. Some furniture on the balcony would have been nice but I am sure it will arrive when the work is complete. Breakfast good if samey. Had no problems with refurbishment bar a smell of paint on a couple of occasions. I think the hotel did a good job given the extent of the work being carried out. Would stay there again if good deal on offer as such a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Average.”
Reviews.Author: Sweety9London
Reviews.Content: I recently visited the Hotel Alexandra with a tour. When we arrived we were greeted with a lift that was falling apart nearly trapping my friends arm in the door! On arrival at our floor , room 501, we arrived to red carpet turned grey with dust from the builders working on the room next door. Even though I cannot complain there was not any noise yet the constant flow of builders using the lifts and mess left in the hallway is not much to be desired for. Breakfast was simple. Croissants, Cereal, Toast and Coffee Machines. No service at breakfast and you had to get everything yourself. Not terrible though. Luckily our room was one of the few refurbished ones with a small flat-screen TV and marble bathrooms and wooden floor but the sheets were extremely thin and made me cold at night. Overall. I would return to this hotel with a group again but maybe not for a family city break.

Reviews.Title: “Small hotel ideal situation for sight seeing value for money”
Reviews.Author: tcider
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideal for the central location and very near to bus route and metro very easy to get from airport via metro for 2 euro.The hotel is very clean and tidy some room under restoration but we saw or heard no noise from this.Our room had abalconey overlooking the street but we could not hear any traffic.Contential breakfast with plenty of choice tea coffee etc.Just around this area plenty of small resturants ,very satisfided with our choice of this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel at a very good location”
Reviews.Author: HU_rabbit
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very good for its price. It's clean and situated in a very good area. The only problems are that the staff speaks poor English and that on the website the additional tax is not mentioned, so we were a bit suprised by the 6-7% added to the original price. (Maybe we didn't read something cautiously enough.) But overall, it was a nice experience, although for those who want to stay in the room during the day might be a bit noisy as some renovation was going on.

Reviews.Title: “Fair price in the heart of Madrid: lots to see - easy by Metro.”
Reviews.Author: holamadrid2
Reviews.Content: In Madrid airport, follow the red diamond sign to the Metro in Terminal 2 (T2) and at the ticket machine select your language from the flags at the top left of the screen. Pay 2 Euro for a single ticket and follow the signs to Line 8 and get a train travelling to Nuevos Ministeros. Go to that station (at the end of the line) and change to Line 10, going in the direction of Puerta Del Sur. Get off at 4th station: Plaza de Espana. At ground level, go up the hill along Gran Via and take the left turning into Calle de San Bernardo (sign high on wall). The hotel is a little way up on the left. (Further up, in the streets on the right, you will find two or three internet cafes, if you want to stay connected). Although I saw a couple of workmen, I suffered no noise from the refurbishment. It was a lovely quiet room, comfortable, clean and spacious. The lifts were smooth and fast, and the stairs made of cool marble. Breakfast is served in the basement, and was a marvellous selection of cereals, croissants, crusty rolls, jams, honey, cheese and sliced meats. I like being able to serve myself, and there was plenty of tea bags, hot water, hot milk and hot coffee. For those who prefer more familiar eateries, there´s a large McDonalds further up the hill on Gran Via, and two Starbucks on that street nearby too. I used the free wi-fi in the McDonalds on the charming plaza of the Opera metro, due south of the hotel. Nearby, go see the incredibly impressive Palacio Real south of the Plaza de Espana: phenomenal in size, elegance and grandeur. In the evening, mime artists (like the silver-coated skier who makes a funny noise every time he moves, plus the seated man with no head but who's wearing a hat and sunglasses, whose white-gloved hand waves at incredulous watching children, out with their parents), street performers and a Mariachi band enliven and captivate throngs of people up the hill at Plaza Callao. There are many traditional Spanish bars and restaurants in the side-streets, displaying appetizing photos of paella; sea food; ham; and pasta dishes. For morning coffee outside, consider the expansive, sheltered, quiet square at Plaza Ramales, where there are many comfortable cushioned metal chairs in the open air outside cafes - ideal on a sunny autumn morning. While crossing the white-striped road at pedestrian traffic lights, listen out for the song bird sound indicating when you can cross, which becomes more insistent as the lights are about to change against you. For a most pleasant 2-day stay in the heart of Madrid, with everything close by, within easy walking distance, consider Hotel Alexandra, in the UK´s Thomas Cook City Breaks package, flying from Gatwick London.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: sloppyjoeBelfast
Reviews.Content: if and when we go back to madrid we,ll be sure to stay here.the alexandra hotel its a very friendly and comfortable place to stay .its location is ideal 2euros from airport by metro 2 stops . 1 euro by bus outside hotel to real madrid stadium.seconds away to gran via. various metro stations whithin walking distance hotel staff were excellent .very informative and friendly.highly recommended for city break value for money

Reviews.Title: “Good location but very, very noisy”
Reviews.Author: paperalice
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel, for the price, can't be beaten. It's very easy to get to it from the airport by metro, close to 3 stops. The staff there were polite and spoke English which was very helpful. The breakfast was very good; bread, cold meats, cereals and pastries. The biggest drawback is that there is construction work going on in this hotel. We had to ask to change rooms as they put us next to the room being worked on. They workmen arrived, very loudly, at half 8 in the morning and didn't stop until 7 at night. We couldn't have a relaxing lie in or an afternoon nap, which is often taken in Spain. The walls are also very thin and you can hear everything from next door. The noise in the hotel spoiled the trip for us and I would not recommend staying whilst this is taking place.

Reviews.Title: “ideal place for special birthday”
Reviews.Author: heather90
Reviews.Content: Very well located hotel and as we were given rooms at the back it was very quiet. It helped that one of our party spoke spanish although i think staff did speak english. The rooms were basic, clean, and good sizes. I would stay there again. At the time of our stay there was work going on inside hotel but this did not worry us and it was not in our area of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but felt unwanted”
Reviews.Author: redbaron55
Reviews.Content: Hard to analyze but here goes. Location is super- close to several good restaurants and Plaza del Sol in short walking distance. A 24 hr convenience store next door. Continental breakfast quite good. Clean, Spartan room but no wash cloths ang gradually less toiletries offered each day. Front desk did not seem to have a concierge and only interested in checking in/out. Very little or no help in trying to understand your problem. Often seemed elite with guests below dignity. Insisted on you speaking Spanish and repeating correctly before they acknowledged understanding. Would not help in mailing post cards, etc. Could be a superior hotel by just having a friendly helpful concierge all the day.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Theboymoon
Reviews.Content: Having read the previous reviews for this place I was a little apprehensive, though for the price I decided to go ahead with it. The reception staff didnt speak great English (though I found this in most of Madrid) but you got by. The hotel is a little grubby and in need of a facelift. The lifts look like they could break down at any time. The breakfasts are poor. You get a choice of 2 cereals, a small bread roll with the usual cheese, ham and salami you normally get at European hotels. I would suggest not bothering booking B&B, nobody checks anyway so you might even be able to blag something. There is a 24hr shop next door to the hotel that provides most stuff to get you by anyway. As for the noise. We stayed on the 4th floor at the back of the hotel and didnt hear any traffic noise although the rooms ARE thin walled and you hear a lot of door slamming, toilet/bathroom activities and conversations. The beds were made each day though the sheets werent changed! There are plus points though. As everyone says the location really is good, the nearest metro is a couple of minutes away, as is the main shopping areas. If you are on a budget then this hotel is probably only on par with some of the better hostels, so you may want to look around. All in all its only a place to get your head down and you get what you pay for at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - not so great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Jtoomey
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Alexandra last weekend - Feb 7th to feb 10th. The location is brilliant as it is located just off of Gran Via, right near all the threatres. The entrance to the hotel was clean & average for a european hotel. We had booked a double room but on arrival were given a twin room & were told that even though there were rooms available! The staff in general were fine but two of the men working on reception were very rude & not one bit helpful. They also refused to speak english, even though they knew exactly what we were saying. The room itself was clean - the beds were changed everyday & the bathroom was small but fine. It's very true about the carpets, they are TERRIBLE & dirty looking. We had breakfast in the hotel on the first morning but I would suggest giving this a miss as the cereal was gone off & there was very little choice. All in all the hotel is fine if ilke me you want a clean, not too expensive hotel to basically put your head down in at night as you will be out all day. One thing that this place really has going for it is it's location, it is so close to everything that you would easily put up with the rudeness & not so great furnishings. Don't think I will be back here though, the Emporer Hotel on the corner on Gran Via looks a much better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cosmo44
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night only at the Hotel Alexandra and would probably do again, even though it is slightly on the pricey side for a hotel in this category (2 star). Perhaps if I'd booked online, I might have paid less. In the event, I simply turned up at the hotel without having made a reservation in advance and was charged the rack rate of 79 Euros (inclusive of tax) for a single room. Even though a notice at reception said that breakfast would cost extra, I wasn't actually charged for it. The room was comfortable enought , though rather functional and characterless,and the bathroom (with bath and matching plug!) was spacious and well-appointed. My room was not at the front of the hotel, so I heard no traffic noise during the night. There is free Internet access in the lobby. The breakfast was fine, though not particularly exciting. Staff were pleasant and efficient. The location is fine - just a minute's walk from the nearest Metro station, Noviciado. One of the city's main thoroughfares, the Gran Via, is only a few hundred metres away There are also some excellent restaurants and tapas bars within a couple of minute's walk from the hotel - I ate at one called Meson O'Luar, which I would warmly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: welshdolly
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights just off The Grand Via near to 3 Metro stations and bus stop excellent for getting around Madrid. Staff were very helpfull. Room was clean and bed linen and towels changed daily. Economical clean basic accomodation but be prepared for traffic noise, but as Madrid is the city that never sleeps I would think that this is a problem in any central city hotel. I would certainly stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Saw a cockroach there - dirty place”
Reviews.Author: Yorkshire_Lass34
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and helpful. However the carpets are very mucky and old. Also I saw a cockroach in the bathroom - this is disgusting and obviously means that they are not clean enough. Also the walls are paper-thin and you could hear v loud coughing, TV noise from a number of ajoining rooms. Only stay here if you don't mind cockroaches, I do so wouldnt stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for a stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel with one of the highest quality/price ratios I ever met, I think. Rooms are clean and comfortable, it is located practically right in the city centre, very close to metro station and easily reachable by metro from the airport. The staff is friendly and when I was there (third week of september 2003) I could get a room on arrival without booking. I think however that during holidays one needs a reservation. Prices are single room: 69 Eur; double room: 87 Eur. Breakfast not included (7 Eur more), but if you walk acorss the street you can have a café con leche and a croissant for just 1.5 Eur. I would definitely recommend it I I'll stay there again next time I visit Madrid.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Sterling
HotelInfo.Address: 29-31 San Bernardo St, 28015 Madrid, Spain (Formerly Hotel Alexandra)
